item.title: Aukus: Australia defends role in security pact amid French condemnation
item.description: The PM defends ending the multi-billion dollar agreement in favour of a new pact with the US and UK.

item.title: Afghanistan: Stay home, female Kabul government workers told
item.description: It is the latest restriction imposed on Afghanistan's women by the country's new Taliban rulers.

item.title: Afghanistan: The 'shattered dreams' of the Ariana cabin crew
item.description: The BBC's Lyse Doucet meets the female crew of Afghanistan's national airline, who are in hiding.

item.title: Israel recaptures final Palestinian escapees
item.description: The two were part of a six man group who tunnelled out of jail almost two weeks ago.

item.title: Manny Pacquiao: Boxing star to run for Philippines president
item.description: Manny Pacquiao is a senator in parliament and remains active in the ring after a successful career.

item.title: Johannesburg mayor Jolidee Matongo killed in car crash
item.description: South Africa's President Ramaphosa pays tribute to Jolidee Matongo, who died at the age of 46.

item.title: Migrants in Texas: Thousands moved to processing centres
item.description: More than 10,000 people have gathered under a bridge in Del Rio, a Texas border town.

item.title: Russia election: Opposition complaints on final day of voting
item.description: Political opponents complain of being silenced amid reports of fraud in the parliamentary vote.

item.title: SpaceX: Inspiration4 amateur astronauts return to Earth after three days
item.description: The four amateur astronauts landed safely in the Atlantic Ocean after three days orbiting Earth.

item.title: Boxer Amir Khan removed from US flight
item.description: The Briton was asked to leave the plane at Newark airport after a reported row over face coverings.

item.title: Emmy Awards 2021: 7 things to know ahead of the ceremony
item.description: That's one possibility at this year's event, where Ted Lasso and The Crown are among other nominees.

item.title: The link between climate change, seaweed and ice cream
item.description: Seaweed production has been affected by warming seas – this is how farmers are adapting.

item.title: US-UK-Australia pact delivers France some hard truths
item.description: The BBC's Hugh Schofield assesses the harsh realities for France after Australia's US-UK deal.

item.title: From Katrina to Ida: How US presidents react to climate change and natural disasters
item.description: Since Hurricane Katrina in 2005, US presidents have realised the impact of their reactions to extreme weather.

item.title: Fake Paralympians boss: 'I didn't know about cheating'
item.description: The man fined for sending non-disabled athletes to the Sydney Paralympics breaks his silence.

item.title: Turkmenistan: Getting Covid in a land where no cases officially exist
item.description: People in Turkmenistan are struggling to get treatment in a system that denies there are any cases.

item.title: Canada election: Why it’s easier to vote in Canada than the US
item.description: Things like advanced voting and federally-run elections make it easier for Canadians to vote.

item.title: Ethiopia: Fact-checking misleading images about hunger in Amhara
item.description: Food shortages are worsening in Ethiopia but some images online are not what they claim to be.

item.title: ICYMI: Surfing dogs and Spain's 'ugliest tomato' contest
item.description: Dogs are making a splash in our round-up of the stories you may have missed this week.

item.title: Get an Eiffel of this performer walking the line in Paris
item.description: Nathan Paulin walks along a 70m (230ft) high slackline attached to an iconic French landmark.

item.title: Morgan Bullock makes professional debut in Riverdance
item.description: Morgan Bullock from Richmond, Virginia, joins the UK touring company of the acclaimed Irish dance show.

item.title: Thousands of migrants gather at US-Mexico border crossing
item.description: At least 10,000 people are camped under the bridge at the US-Mexico border, in poor conditions.

item.title: Canada election: Why it takes 30 years to buy a house in Canada
item.description: Canada's skyrocketing housing costs have become a key election issue this year.
